did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Research materials, architectural plans, and correspondence.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Plans, sections, elevations, and perspectives for an ideal mental hospital, "Opus N," designed by Herbert Scott Olin. Also, plans and elevations of other buildings designed by Olin; a letter from Olin's brother, J.D. Olin; and an explanation of the "Opus N" project.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Herbert Scott Olin graduated from Cornell University College of Architecture in 1900. He studied in Paris for two years, and returned to the United States to practice architecture. For a short time, he served as an instructor in Cornell's architecture program. He won awards for submissions to several international competitions, including one in Canberra, Australia. He died in Utica State Hospital in 1935.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Plans, sections, elevations, and perspectives for an ideal mental hospital, "Opus N," designed by Herbert Scott Olin. Also, plans and elevations of other buildings designed by Olin; a letter from Olin's brother, J.D. Olin, with biographical information about Olin; and an explanation of the "Opus N" project.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Herbert Scott Olin architectural drawings, #1542. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Collection consists of a single box and 5 oversize folders. Online guide unavailable.
